comments:
DW (6/7/00 5:17:06 PM)
	While releasing > 1000 resources to a server, I received "Problems" dialog with the message:
		"Problems occurred synchronizing the selected resources".

	When I looked at the "details", the message was: "SeverException."

	To create the workspace:
	1) Start a new empty workbench
	2) Turn auto-build off
	3) Create projects & solutions by importing from file system into
		the following project structure (available on "ftp.min.oti.com", outgoing/eBAF/1FW747src.zip)
		(Created each project as a Java Project, with a server property of "mercury")
			Tp1NLS
				Tp1Compiler
				Tp1Core
				Tp1DAV4J
				Tp1JavaModel
				Tp1WebDAV
				Tp1XML

	4) Select the solution and release to the server.
	5) Received error message

DJH (6/8/00 9:31:37 AM)
	Was able to release solution OK to machine here in Ottawa. Some questions:
	- did you get a single error message or multiple ones with the same "ServerException" message?
	- were some of the projects already on the server when you went to release them?
				
DW (6/8/00 8:45:13 AM)
	I received a single error message.
	I tried several times, with new project names each time - thus the projects were not
	already on the server.

PCD (6/8/00 2:01:46 PM)
	Could reproduce the bug in the JDK version (0.21) but not inside VAJ.

DJH (6/8/00 4:25:03 PM)
	Was able to release onto gold using both VAJ and JDK. A local/remote server thing maybe?

DJH (6/8/00 6:10:16 PM)
	Was able to release to hydrogen on JDK. Weird.

DW (6/9/00 10:18:49 AM)
	I caught this exception by instrumenting code - I found that a DAV4JSystemException was being
	thrown, and I added a printStackTrace() to:

	public DAV4JSystemException(Exception e) {
		super();
		e.printStackTrace();
		fWrappedException = e;
	}

DW (6/9/00 10:49:52 AM)
	Found that the failure occurrs on WIN NT & Win 2000, but not on Win 98

DJH (6/12/00 4:03:38 PM)
	See also:
		1FW76SX: IWT:WINNT - release of large imported jar takes several tries

JM (6/22/2000 11:18:51 AM)
	README with JEP's notes

JM (6/22/2000 2:10:36 PM)
	README from JEP 
	In some cases, users may experience problems when releasing a large number of 
	resources (>1000) while running the WebSphere Studio Workbench Java 1.2.2 Edition.

	The problem occurs during a release and is made known to the user through a "Problems" 
	dialog with the message: "Problems occurred synchronizing the selected resources".  
	The "details" of the problem indicates that a "SeverException" has occured.  In general
	this problem is not fatal in that released and unreleased resources are consistent in
	both the server and the workbench.  Re-releasing the resources which did not get released
	resolves this problem.

	Unfortunately, the cause of the problem is related to the a subtlety in the TCP implementation
	in Windows NT (Win98 users will not experience this problem) which prevents sockets 
	from being reused effectively.  As such, immediately retrying the release operation will 
	not always work.  Users may have to wait until the TCP stack clears some unused sockets 
	before attempting to release the resources.  This may take a number (1-4) of minutes.

JM (6/22/2000 2:56:40 PM)
	Added to readme

JM (01/02/2001 12:15:24 PM)
	This is a severe problem for which we need to find a fix/workaround.
	Moving to candidates

Additional work on target management is not a committed item in the 2.0 plan. 
Changing resolution to LATER.

Target management is now provided by Platform/VCM and is based on a totally 
different implementation.
Closing.
